SENT.plain: Antiphospholipid antibody syndrome is a very important cause of cerebral infarction, myocardial infarction, and repeated pregnancy losses in women
We present an extremely rare case of a 44-year-old man with antiphospholipid syndrome who collapsed and died suddenly
At autopsy, he was found to have both cerebral and myocardial infarction

In all young patients with cerebral infarction, myocardial infarction, pulmonary embolism, recurrent miscarriages, and unexplained low platelet count, one must consider the strong possibility of antiphospholipid antibody syndrome
